Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2011 10:59PM fightn4fam wrote: My hair is growing in dark and full, not patchy.  My last dose of Taxotere & Cytoxan was Sept 15th.  I think by the middle of October my hair should have started growing, but I think it started the end of October.  I have a full head of hair, but very pixie like,  I know a girl who finished Chemo after me and has more hair than me.  But at least I see it's coming in... whew, worried there for a bit.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2011 12:53PM fightn4fam wrote: Thank you guys.  You are all so helpful.  I see my doctor next week.  My GP had given me Nexium for the esophogeal spells, and I think that may be causing the itching.  But when I stop the Nexium my spasms start again and they supercede the icthing.  So I stayed on it.  There's no marks whatsoever on my hands and feet.  It's an itching from inside and no matter how much I scratch there's nothing :/.  I will mention it to the Onc to see what she thinks it might be.  But it definitely feels like some sorta allergy.  Love you gals :)♥  Hope you are all doing well.  You ladies in here are the ones that have helped me get through this whole ordeal.
Posts.Title: Itchiness please help me fightn4fam fightn4fam

Posts.Content: fightn4fam wrote: I am on my 3rd round out of 4 of Chemo (Taxotere and Cytoxan).  All of a sudden I have this itchiness on my hands and feet.  It's really bad.  I have no rash or anything, just this bad itching mainly on my hands and feet.  I can wash all I want with Carress and it's not helping.  Antihistimine helps a little temporary.  Chemo has me so worn out and I keep getting excruciatingly painful esophogeal spasms.  This itching is over the top.  Can someone please help???  I'm not new to the posts.  It's my second time posting but I had forgotten how to do it, so sorry in advance. Dx 3/21/2011, ILC, 2cm, Stage II, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 5/13/2011 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel, Underarm/Axillary Chemotherapy 7/15/2011 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 10/24/2011 Hormonal Therapy 12/14/2011 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Itchiness please help me fightn4fam fightn4fam

Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2011 03:06AM fightn4fam wrote: Thank you guys.  I've been writing everyone's advice down.  I will ask the Onc this week.  I used to get minor itching but it wasn't until I took Nexium that I've noticed the intense itching.  I'm thinking allergic reaction to Nexium but not sure.  I stopped the Nexium but then the esophogeal spasms were horrible and I could not deal with them so I went back to Nexium.  Could not stay away long enough :(.  Ughhh... I can't wait until this is all a bad memory.  I pray for all the girls here every night as well as for myself.  Hope everyone's managing ok.  I have taken my cancer and turned my tears into jokes.  It keeps me going.  But I only make jokes of my cancer and my situations.  Just to lighten the air around me.  My hubby calls me the Cancer Comedian.  There is nothing funny about cancer, so please don't get this wrong... but I make fun of my situations that I have experienced and take songs and change the lyrics to fit me.  For example, I took the Chicago song "If you leave me now" and sang it as my hair fell off in chunks as I washed and combed it, with tears strollin' down my face.  My hubby says, I have a good attitude.  I call it tears of a clown.  The jokes helps everyone around me cope, including me.  Again, I joke about me and my situation and would never joke about anyone else.
Posts.Title: Itchiness please help me fightn4fam fightn4fam

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2011 04:41PM fightn4fam wrote: Thank you ma111.  I hope you are doing well also :).

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2012 02:45AM fightn4fam wrote: Yeah, the itching eventually stopped.  Man oh man, was it horrible, and it was only on my hands and feet.  It was my palms and the soles of my feet... something weird... there were no marks, hives or anything, just the severe itch.  Glad it's over and done with :).  Hope you are doing well.
